|dead-url=no}}</ref>
=== Critical response === {{Multiple image|total_width=270 |image1=Michael Fassbender by Gage Skidmore 2015.jpg|width1=1446|height1=1962 |image2=KateWinsletByAndreaRaffin2011.jpg|width2=529|height2=669 |footer=Fassbender and Winslet received critical acclaim for their performances as Jobs and Hoffman, respectively.}} On the review aggregator [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the film has an approval rating of 86%, based on 282 reviews, with an average rating of 7.6/10. The website's critical consensus reads: "Like the tech giant co-founded by its subject, ''Steve Jobs'' gathers brilliant people to deliver a product whose elegance belies the intricate complexities at its core."<ref name=RT>{{cite web |url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/steve_jobs_2015/ |title=Steve Jobs (2015) |publisher=[[Fandango Media]] |work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|accessdate=April 16, 2018 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.rottentomatoes.com%2Fm%2Fsteve_jobs_2015%2F&date=2016-09-03 |archive-date=2016-09-03 |dead-url=no}}</ref> On [[Metacritic]], the film has a [[weighted average]] score of 82 out of 100, based on 45 reviews, indicating "universal acclaim."<ref name=met>{{cite web |title=Steve Jobs Reviews |url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/steve-jobs |work=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|accessdate=November 9, 2015 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.metacritic.com%2Fmovie%2Fsteve-jobs&date=2016-09-03 |archive-date=2016-09-03 |dead-url=no}}</ref> According to [[CinemaScore]], audiences gave the film an average grade of "A-" on an A+ to F scale.<ref name="opening" />
[[Todd McCarthy]] of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' said Boyle's "electric" direction "temperamentally complements Sorkin's highly theatrical three-act study" and praised Fassbender in the role, who "doesn't closely physically resemble the man, [yet] he fully delivers the essentials of how we have come to perceive the man."<ref name=hrrev>{{cite web |last=McCarthy |first=Todd |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movie/steve-jobs/review/820561 |title='Steve Jobs': Telluride Review |accessdate=September 6, 2015 |date=September 6, 2015 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.hollywoodreporter.com%2Fmovie%2Fsteve-jobs%2Freview%2F820561&date=2016-09-03 |archive-date=2016-09-03 |dead-url=no}}</ref> Justin Chang of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' extolled the film as "a wildly creative fantasia...a brilliant, maddening, ingeniously designed and monstrously self-aggrandizing movie."<ref name="variety">{{cite news |title=Telluride Film Review: ''Steve Jobs''|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/festivals/steve-jobs-review-michael-fassbender-telluride-film-festival-1201586996/ |last=Chang |first=Justin |date=September 6, 2015 |accessdate=September 6, 2015 |work=Variety |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fvariety.com%2F2015%2Ffilm%2Ffestivals%2Fsteve-jobs-review-michael-fassbender-telluride-film-festival-1201586996%2F&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref> [[Sasha Stone]], writing for ''[[TheWrap]]'', stated that Fassbender gives "a stunning knockout" performance as Jobs in a film that is "a kind of talk opera", which to some might seem to be "Sorkin overkill but the same could be said for the best of them: [[David Mamet]], [[Edward Albee]], [[Paddy Chayefsky]] and even [[William Shakespeare]]. Sorkin is not trying to do anything but write in his own style, thus this film and its exceptional dialogue leaves its mark as profoundly as Jobs himself left his."<ref name=stonerev>{{cite web |last=Stone |first=Sasha |url=http://www.thewrap.com/steve-jobs-telluride-review-michael-fassbender-is-stunning-in-breathtaking-relentless-biopic/ |title=''Steve Jobs'' Telluride Review: Michael Fassbender Is Stunning in Breathtaking, Relentless Biopic |accessdate=September 12, 2015 |date=September 5, 2015 |work=TheWrap |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.thewrap.com%2Fsteve-jobs-telluride-review-michael-fassbender-is-stunning-in-breathtaking-relentless-biopic%2F&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref> Eric Kohn of [[IndieWire]] gave the film a "B+", stating that "the cast vanishes into their parts...buried under makeup and a distinctive Polish accent, Winslet's chameleonesque transformation is bested only by Fassbender, whose vivid expressions and constant movement turn him into a physical marvel." He also noted that Boyle "drops his usual whirlwind editing style and instead develops an engrossing chamber piece."<ref name=iw>{{cite web|last=Kohn|first=Eric|url=http://www.indiewire.com/article/telluride-review-danny-boyles-steve-jobs-is-like-its-subject-flawed-but-fascinating-20150906|title=Telluride Review: Danny Boyle's ''Steve Jobs'' is Like Its Subject — Flawed But Fascinating|accessdate=September 6, 2015|date=September 6, 2015|work=[[IndieWire]]|archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.indiewire.com%2Farticle%2Ftelluride-review-danny-boyles-steve-jobs-is-like-its-subject-flawed-but-fascinating-20150906&date=2016-09-04|archive-date=2016-09-04|dead-url=no}}</ref>
Benjamin Lee of ''[[The Guardian]]'' gave the film three out of five stars, writing that "despite the film constantly informing you of just how incredibly important everything all is, it's disappointingly difficult to truly care about what's taking place." He blames Sorkin's "dominating" script, arguing that "the dialogue stifles" and that "the actors are tasked with trying to wrangle enough breathing space to offer up something of their own." He also feels that while it is "Boyle's best film for years," his direction "plays second fiddle" to a script that verges on a kind of "Apple-sponsored hero iWorship."<ref name=guarrev>{{cite web |last=Lee |first=Benjamin |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2015/sep/06/steve-jobs-movie-review-michael-fassbender-telluride |title=Steve Jobs review: Fassbender excels but iWorship required if you're to care |accessdate=September 12, 2015 |date=September 6, 2015 |work=The Guardian |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Ffilm%2F2015%2Fsep%2F06%2Fsteve-jobs-movie-review-michael-fassbender-telluride&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref> [[Joe Nocera]] of ''[[The New York Times]]'', who knew Jobs well, took issue with "how little the film has to do with the flesh and blood Steve Jobs." Characterizing the movie as pure "fiction", he went on to say, "In ways both large and small, Sorkin − as well as Michael Fassbender, the actor who plays Jobs − has failed to capture him in any meaningful sense."<ref name=Nocera>{{cite news|last1=Nocera|first1=Joe|authorlink=Joe Nocera|title=Aaron Sorkin's ''Steve Jobs'' Con|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/10/13/opinion/aaron-sorkins-steve-jobs-con.html|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=The New York Times|date=October 13, 2015|archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2015%2F10%2F13%2Fopinion%2Faaron-sorkins-steve-jobs-con.html&date=2016-09-04|archive-date=2016-09-04|dead-url=no}}</ref>
=== Historical accuracy === [[Danny Boyle]], the film's director, speaking on the creative liberties he took with portraying Steve Jobs said, "[it] was what [[Shakespeare]] used to do. He would take some of the facts about a man of power and he would guess at a lot of the rest and just gotten away at actually getting at the human in it. And that's what's wonderful about the writing I think, is that it acknowledges the people who disliked Steve Jobs, the people he hurt. But in the end, he brings it back to a very simple father-daughter relationship that he has to admit that he has made some of the most beautiful things in the world."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.slashfilm.com/danny-boyle-steve-jobs-interview/2/ |title=Interview: Director Danny Boyle Talks About The Making Of ''Steve Jobs''|last=Sciretta |first=Peter |work=[[/Film]] |date=October 15, 2015 |accessdate=November 18, 2015 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.slashfilm.com%2Fdanny-boyle-steve-jobs-interview%2F2%2F&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
[[John Sculley]] praised [[Jeff Daniels]]' portrayal of him, but claims the film misrepresented [[Apple Inc.|Apple]]'s success with the [[Macintosh|Mac]], and argues that Jobs was "much nicer" than depicted.<ref name="sculleymacrumors">{{cite web |url=http://www.macrumors.com/2015/10/06/john-sculley-on-steve-jobs-movie/ |title=John Sculley Talks Steve Jobs Movie, Impressed With Jeff Daniels' Portrayal of Him |last=Sumra |first=Husain |work=[[MacRumors]] |date=October 6, 2015 |accessdate=November 19, 2015 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.macrumors.com%2F2015%2F10%2F06%2Fjohn-sculley-on-steve-jobs-movie%2F&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref><ref name="sculleywsj">{{cite web |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2015/10/06/john-sculley-on-steve-jobs-the-movie-the-man-and-his-own-role-in-the-drama/ |title=John Sculley on Steve Jobs: The Movie, the Man and His Own Role in the Drama |last=Chai |first=Barbara |work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |date=October 6, 2015 |accessdate=November 19, 2015 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fblogs.wsj.com%2Fspeakeasy%2F2015%2F10%2F06%2Fjohn-sculley-on-steve-jobs-the-movie-the-man-and-his-own-role-in-the-drama%2F&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref><ref name="sculleyfrance">{{cite web |url=http://www.france24.com/en/20151105-business-web-summit-dublin-john-sculley-apple-steve-jobs-film |title=Former Apple CEO: 'Steve Jobs was nicer than new film shows' |last=Carroll |first=Stephen |work=[[France 24]] |date=November 5, 2015 |accessdate=November 19, 2015 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.france24.com%2Fen%2F20151105-business-web-summit-dublin-john-sculley-apple-steve-jobs-film&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref> [[Bill Atkinson]] denounced the film as "not truthful at all. That wasn't his character, and the events didn't happen. You think of Jobs having a [[reality distortion field]]. I think of Aaron Sorkin as having ... a history distortion field". Atkinson said that "the only thing he got right in that movie" was the "spot on" depiction of Hoffman, including her accent and how she "tried to rein in Steve from ... making an ass of himself".<ref name="Tri247">{{Triangulation|247|[[Bill Atkinson]]}}</ref>
[[Steve Wozniak]] (who consulted with Sorkin before he had written the screenplay) commented on a trailer released on July 1, 2015 that he does not "talk that way... I would never accuse the graphical interface of being stolen. I never made comments to the effect that I had credit (genius) taken from me... The lines I heard spoken were not things I would say but carried the right message, at least partly... I felt a lot of the real Jobs in the trailer, although a bit exaggerated."<ref name=anyway>{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-07-02/wozniak-says-scene-in-jobs-trailer-is-fiction-loves-it-anyway |title=Wozniak Says Scene in Jobs Trailer Is Fiction, Loves It Anyway |accessdate=July 2, 2015 |last=Sakoui |first=Anousha |date=July 1, 2015 |publisher=[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]] |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.bloomberg.com%2Fnews%2Farticles%2F2015-07-02%2Fwozniak-says-scene-in-jobs-trailer-is-fiction-loves-it-anyway&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref> Wozniak did not ask to see the final script because he did not "think that would be appropriate... it is the creative work of the producer and writer and actors and director and others."<ref name=anyway /> He also noted that the trailer's reference to Jobs' initial rejection of his daughter [[Lisa Brennan-Jobs|Lisa]] evoked an emotional response: "It was hard on me, even being quiet, when Jobs refused to acknowledge his child when the money didn't matter, and I can almost cry remembering it."<ref name=anyway /> In September 2015, after seeing a rough cut of the film, Wozniak stated that he felt like he "was actually watching Steve Jobs and the others [....] not actors playing them, I give full credit to Danny Boyle and Aaron Sorkin for getting it so right."<ref name=filmpre>{{cite news |url=http://deadline.com/2015/09/steve-wozniak-says-steve-jobs-the-movie-gets-it-all-correct-1201516399/ |title=Steve Wozniak On ''Steve Jobs'': "I Felt Like I Was Actually Watching Him" – Telluride Film Festival |accessdate=September 7, 2015 |last=Hammond |first=Pete |date=September 6, 2015 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdeadline.com%2F2015%2F09%2Fsteve-wozniak-says-steve-jobs-the-movie-gets-it-all-correct-1201516399%2F&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref> In an interview with ''[[San Francisco Chronicle]]'' on February 10, 2016, Wozniak claimed that the film's scenes between him and Jobs never occurred in reality. Wozniak specifically mentioned that he never requested Jobs to acknowledge the [[Apple II]] team onstage, as was shown in the movie. However, he added that Jobs did purportedly show a lack of respect towards the group. When asked about the accuracy of the film's portrayal of Jobs, Wozniak replied: "In real life, to real people, that's the way he could be, very sharp, (although) never quite as much as in the movie."<ref name="wozniaksfchron">{{cite web |url=http://www.sfchronicle.com/business/article/Woz-talks-Steve-Jobs-geek-culture-and-6824747.php |title='Woz' talks Steve Jobs, geek culture and Silicon Valley Comic Con |first=Benny |last=Evangelista |work=[[San Francisco Chronicle]] |date=February 10, 2016 |accessdate=February 18, 2016 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sfchronicle.com%2Fbusiness%2Farticle%2FWoz-talks-Steve-Jobs-geek-culture-and-6824747.php&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
[[Edwin Catmull]], president of [[Pixar|Pixar Animation Studios]] and [[Walt Disney Animation Studios]], felt that Jobs would "be appalled" at his depiction in the film, arguing that he was a kinder person later in life than is portrayed in the picture. In an interview with ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'', Catmull commented, "When [Jobs] left Apple, he then entered into what really is the classic [[hero's journey]]: He's wandering in the wilderness, he's working with NeXT, it's not working. He's working with Pixar, we're failing. In that process, Steve learned some major lessons, and he changed. He became an empathetic person, [...] that aspect of the change of Steve was missed."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/disney-pixars-ed-catmull-good-840292 |title=Disney-Pixar's Ed Catmull on 'Good Dinosaur,' Female Directors and Why Steve Jobs Would Be "Appalled" by 'Steve Jobs' |date=November 20, 2015 |last=Belloni |first=Matthew |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=November 21, 2015 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.hollywoodreporter.com%2Fnews%2Fdisney-pixars-ed-catmull-good-840292&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
In a ''[[Bloomberg West]]'' interview with [[Emily Chang (journalist)|Emily Chang]] on August 26, 2015, [[Andrea Cunningham|Andy Cunningham]] called it "a wonderful film.... It's an incredible character study of a really complex man. Aaron [Sorkin] and Danny Boyle did a fabulous job with it." Her portrayal by [[Sarah Snook]] was a "small role but professionally done."<ref>{{cite news |last1=Chang |first1=Emily |title=Andy Cunningham: What It Was Like Working With Steve Jobs |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2015-08-27/andy-cunningham-what-it-was-like-working-with-steve-jobs |website=Bloomberg |accessdate=August 27, 2015 |date=August 26, 2015 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.bloomberg.com%2Fnews%2Fvideos%2F2015-08-27%2Fandy-cunningham-what-it-was-like-working-with-steve-jobs&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref> The film also portrays Andy as participating in the iMac launch, even though she was not working with Apple at that time.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Graham |first1=Jefferson |title=She was Steve Jobs' first publicist |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2015/09/06/she-steve-jobs-first-publicist/71787020/ |accessdate=September 12, 2015 |work=USA Today |date=September 6, 2015 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.usatoday.com%2Fstory%2Ftech%2F2015%2F09%2F06%2Fshe-steve-jobs-first-publicist%2F71787020%2F&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref> Journalist [[Walt Mossberg]] compared ''Steve Jobs'' to the [[Orson Welles]] film ''[[Citizen Kane]]'', which was loosely based on the life of [[William Randolph Hearst]]. Mossberg has stated that while both films are aesthetically well-developed, Welles created a fictional set of characters in order to clarify that his film was a work of fiction. In contrast, according to Mossberg (who knew Jobs for 14 years), Sorkin's decision to use real instead of fictional names detracts from the quality of a film which appears to be a biopic and yet is a work of fiction. Mossberg states that "the Steve Jobs portrayed in Sorkin's film isn't the man I knew. Sorkin chose to cherry-pick and exaggerate some of the worst aspects of Jobs' character, and to focus on a period of his career when he was young and immature [...] It would be as if you made a movie called ''[[JFK (film)|JFK]]'' almost entirely focused on Kennedy's womanizing and political rivalries, and said nothing about civil rights and the [[Cuban Missile Crisis]]. Sorkin opts to end his story just as Jobs is poised to both reel off an unprecedented string of world-changing products and to mature into a much broader, kinder manager and person."<ref name=mossberg>{{cite news |url=https://www.theverge.com/2015/10/21/9578921/steve-jobs-movie-review-walt-mossberg |title=Mossberg: The Steve Jobs I knew isn't in this movie |accessdate=October 22, 2015 |last=Mossberg |first=Walt |date=October 21, 2015 |work=[[The Verge]] |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.theverge.com%2F2015%2F10%2F21%2F9578921%2Fsteve-jobs-movie-review-walt-mossberg&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref>
=== Accolades === {{Main|List of accolades received by Steve Jobs (film)}} ''Steve Jobs'' has received dozens of industry and critics awards. The film garnered four [[Golden Globe Award]] nominations for [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Drama|Best Actor]] for Fassbender, [[Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actress – Motion Picture|Best Supporting Actress]] for Winslet, [[Golden Globe Award for Best Screenplay|Best Screenplay]] for Sorkin, and [[Golden Globe Award for Best Original Score|Best Original Score]] for Pemberton. It won two, for both Winslet and Sorkin.<ref>{{cite web |last=Rosen |first=Christopher |title=Golden Globes 2016 winners list: Leonardo DiCaprio, The Revenant, Brie Larson & more |url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/01/10/golden-globes-2016-winners-list |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |date=January 10, 2016 |accessdate=January 11, 2016 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ew.com%2Farticle%2F2016%2F01%2F10%2Fgolden-globes-2016-winners-list&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref> On February 14, 2016, Winslet won the [[BAFTA Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role]].<ref>{{cite web |title=BAFTA Awards: ''The Revenant'' Wins Best Film, Actor, Director (FULL LIST) |url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/bafta-awards-winners-2016-complete-list-british-academy-film-television-1201706004/ |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate=February 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fvariety.com%2F2016%2Ffilm%2Fnews%2Fbafta-awards-winners-2016-complete-list-british-academy-film-television-1201706004%2F&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref> Both Fassbender and Winslet received [[Academy Award]] nominations for [[Academy Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] and [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress|Best Supporting Actress]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Oscar Nominations 2015: Full List |url=https://variety.com/2015/film/news/oscar-nominations-2015-full-list-academy-award-nominees-1201405517/ |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate=January 15, 2016 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fvariety.com%2F2015%2Ffilm%2Fnews%2Foscar-nominations-2015-full-list-academy-award-nominees-1201405517%2F&date=2016-09-04 |archive-date=2016-09-04 |dead-url=no}}</ref>

The '''Boston Foundation''', founded in 1915, is one of the oldest and largest [[community foundation]]s in the United States.<ref name="2008 report">[http://www.tbf.org/uploadedFiles/tbforg/Utility_Navigation/Multimedia_Library/Reports/2008%20Annual%20Web.pdf AR]. (PDF) . Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> Serving the Greater Boston area, it is made up of some 1,000 separate charitable funds established by thousands of donors over more than 100 years.<ref name="2008 report" /> Funds are established either for the general benefit of the community or for special purposes, such as supporting individual nonprofit organizations in perpetuity. With some $1 billion in assets, today the Foundation is one of the largest funders in New England. The Foundation and its donors make more than $100 million in grants every year.<ref name="2008 report" /> Since 2001, the Boston Foundation has also served as a major civic leader by commissioning and publishing research, providing a platform for discussion related to a wide range of challenges facing Greater Boston and the region and contributing to the development of public policy.
== History == The Boston Foundation was founded in 1915 by Charles E. and Charles M. Rogerson, who were father and son.<ref name="beginning">http://www.tbf.org/uploadedFiles/tbforg/There_at_the_Beginning/There%20from%20the%20Beginning.pdf</ref> Originally called the Permanent Charity Fund, it was one of the first community foundations in the United States, but, thanks to a bequest of $4 million shortly after it was launched, it was the first with the resources to begin grant making.<ref name="beginning" /> In 1959 another large bequest of $20 million catapulted the Foundation into an era during which it made early investments in some of the most important nonprofit institutions in Boston, from WGBH to the New England Aquarium to the clean up of Boston Harbor. 1985, the foundation was renamed the Boston Foundation, and Anna Faith Jones became the President—the first African-American woman to lead a major foundation in the United States. Today, it is led by President and CEO, Paul S. Grogan, who is credited with transforming the Foundation into a major civic leader for the city and region.<ref name="TBF-84">[http://www.tbf.org/AboutTBF/AboutTBFDetail.aspx?id=84 Meet Our President]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref>
== Mission == As Greater Boston’s community foundation since 1915, the Boston Foundation devotes its resources to building and sustaining a vital, prosperous city and region, where justice and opportunity are extended to everyone. It fulfills this mission in three principal ways:
* Making grants to nonprofit organizations and designing special funding initiatives to address this community’s critical challenges; * Working in partnership with donors to achieve [[High impact philanthropy|high-impact philanthropy]]; and * Serving as a civic hub and center of information, where ideas are shared, levers for change are identified, and common agendas for the future are developed. <ref name="TBF-80">[http://www.tbf.org/abouttbf/abouttbfdetail.aspx?id=80 Mission Statement]. Tbf.org (December 15, 2005). Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref>
== Governance == The Foundation is overseen by a 20-member Board of Directors, selected to represent diverse community interests.<ref name="TBF-82">[http://www.tbf.org/AboutTBF/AboutTBFDetail.aspx?id=82 Meet Our Board]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> The staff includes professionals in grant making, philanthropy, finance and administration, public policy and communications.<ref name="TBF-100">[http://www.tbf.org/AboutTBF/AboutTBFDetail.aspx?id=100 TBF Staff]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref>
== Grant Making == Over more than 100 years of grantmaking, the Foundation has been there at the beginning for numerous fresh ideas and new institutions by providing crucial seed capital and other support.<ref name="beginning" /> Among its greatest accomplishments are grants that helped to launch [[WGBH-TV]], now considered the nation’s premier public television station.<ref name="beginning" /> It also made an early investment in the redevelopment of Faneuil Hall into a thriving marketplace, often credited with sparking the renewal of Boston in recent decades; and helped to shape Boston’s Longwood Medical Center area.<ref name="beginning" /> The Foundation invested in the most extensive network of community health centers in the nation and made grants to a group called Save the Harbor/Save the Bay to clean up Boston Harbor.<ref name="beginning" /> What was once one of the filthiest harbors in the world is now one of the cleanest.<ref name="beginning" /> It also made early grants to numerous organizations that started in Boston and spread throughout the country, like City Year, Citizen Schools and Year Up.<ref name="beginning" />
Today, the Foundation and its donors make grants<ref name="grants">[http://www.tbf.org/GrantSeekers/GrantSeekersHome.aspx Grant Seekers]. Tbf.org (July 1, 2011). Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> each year to hundreds of nonprofits in Greater Boston, across the country and around the world.<ref name="2008 report" /> In addition to placing a special strategic focus on the areas of Education, Health and Wellness, Jobs and Economic Development, Neighborhoods and Housing, and Arts and Culture. It also provides leadership for special initiatives, such as the Success Boston College Completion Initiative and SkillWorks.
== Civic leadership == Through its Understanding Boston series, the Boston Foundation commissions research from universities, think tanks and other organizations and shares this information through a series of forums that are attended by thousands of people every year.<ref name="UB">[http://www.tbf.org/UnderstandingBoston/Default.aspx The Boston Foundation]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> Issues addressed through Understanding Boston embrace a broad range of issues, including public education, housing, the workforce, health, philanthropy and the nonprofit sector, the arts and the urban environment.<ref name="UB" />
In addition to providing fresh information and bringing people together to discuss findings, the Foundation also creates Task Forces and Action Agendas to produce positive change. A number of issues have been influenced by this process. The Commonwealth Housing Task Force created a Smart Growth housing effort to address the current shortage of housing in the state.<ref>[http://www.tbf.org/chtf The Commonwealth Housing Task Force]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> The program has led to dozens of towns and cities building thousands of new units of housing.<ref>[http://www.tbf.org/tbfgen1.asp?id=1991 The Boston Foundation]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> The Foundation’s civic leadership also helped lead to the Massachusetts Cultural Facilities Fund, which has provided millions in state funding for cultural facilities.<ref>http://www.tbf.org/uploadedFiles/tbforg/There_at_the_Beginning/ThereForTheArts.pdf</ref> Its work examining the current Criminal Offender Record Information (CORI) system has led to a complete re-evaluation of the system by state law makers.<ref>[http://www.tbf.org/UnderstandingBoston/CommunitySafety.aspx?id=6128 The Boston Foundation]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> The Foundation’s research and public information campaign related to public education has influenced former Governor Deval Patrick's approach to education across the state.<ref>[http://www.tbf.org/UnderstandingBoston/Education.aspx?id=6130 The Boston Foundation]. Tbf.org. Retrieved on October 20, 2011.</ref> Other issues that have benefited from the Foundation’s civic leadership includea new collaborative for the life sciences, issues related to health and health care and the revenue-raising capacity of Massachusetts cities.<ref name="2008 report" />
== Boston Indicators Project == [http://www.bostonindicators.org/?q&sortBy=date&sortOrder=desc&page=1 Boston Indicators] is a research center at the Boston Foundation that seeks a thriving Greater Boston for all residents across all neighborhoods. They do this by analyzing key indicators of well-being and by researching promising ideas for making Boston more prosperous, equitable and just. To ensure that the Indicators work informs active efforts to improve our city, they work in deep partnership with community groups, civic leaders and Boston’s civic data community to produce special reports and host public convenings.
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== * The [http://www.library.neu.edu/archives/collect/findaids/m127find.htm Persistent Poverty Project records, 1985–2002] are located in the Northeastern University Libraries, Archives and Special Collections Department, Boston, MA.

{{Content|date=June 2010}} '''The Burke Group'''This should not be confused with the Canadian [[temporary worker]] and human resources recruitment agency by the same name, est. 1979. For the Canadian firm, see The Burke Group's [http://www.theburkegroup.com/ website]. is a U.S.-based international [[management consulting]] firm established in 1982 with headquarters in Los Angeles.{{cite web|title=The Burke Group|url=http://www.theburkegroup.us.com/|accessdate=4 Jan 2010}} The Burke Group describes itself as an "international leader" in guiding management during union recognition campaigns. It provides commercial services to private and public employers. Services are also offered toward business development and leadership training. Critics of The Burke Group call the firm's practices professional [[union busting]].{{cite news|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/5547ad92-d8d5-11dc-8b22-0000779fd2ac.html?nclick_check=1|title=TUC acts to thwart US ‘union busters’|last=Taylor|first=Andrew|date=2008-02-12|work=Financial Times|accessdate=2009-02-21}} The [[Chief executive officer|CEO]] and President is David J. Burke. ==Business== The Burke Group Labor assists employers in responding to automatic recognition and ballot campaigns. According to its U.S. website, employees considering a [[trade union]]:
"Employees want and deserve to hear both pro employer and pro union arguments in order to make an informed choice before voting in a union election. A [[union organizer]] is experienced at running a union membership campaign whereas employers have little if any experience on how to respond to them when this activity presents itself. Once union activity becomes apparent, employers generally seek TBG and/or legal counsel in order to be better able to respond accurately and lawfully to employees."{{Cite web |url=http://www.tbglabor.com/faq.aspx |title=TBG Labor's FAQ on union avoidance |access-date=2009-03-07 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090804081408/http://www.tbglabor.com/faq.aspx#faq3/ |archive-date=2009-08-04 |dead-url=yes |df= }}
Although their business has reportedly been international in scope since its inception, their services increased in the EU "after the [[Employee Relations Act 1999]] (ERA 1999)http://www.eurofound.europa.eu/eiro/2000/07/feature/uk0007183f.htmhttp://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1999/26/contents was established in June 2000 and triggered new procedures related to trade union recognition and ballot elections".[http://www.theburkegroup.eu.com/services.aspx?cid=11#19/TBG-EU Website-Trade Union Recognition Campaigns retrieved 4/27/2013] UK employers may seek the services of labor relations consultants such as The Burke Group and/or legal counsel to assist them thru the new law's complexities regarding automatic recognition or subsequent ballot elections. "Human Rights Watch does not take the position that employer silence is required under international standards. Rather, non-interference is required by international standards."https://www.hrw.org[Human Rights Watch: Letter to member of the Board of Management, Human Rights Watch, July 29, 2010 (copy on file with Human Rights Watch)] As stated by Dr. John Logan: "Britain has a “hybrid” system of union recognition: employers can recognize the union without a demonstration of majority support, or, if the employers refuse voluntary recognition, the Central Arbitration Committee can recognize the union on the basis of documentary evidence of union membership or by holding a ballot election."{{cite web |url=http://www.lera.uiuc.edu/pubs/perspectives/onlinecompanion/Spring2009Vol10/Logan.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-01-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120805113538/http://www.lera.uiuc.edu/pubs/perspectives/onlinecompanion/Spring2009Vol10/Logan.html |archivedate=2012-08-05 |df= }} Union Recognition and Collective Bargaining: How Does the United States Compare With Other Democracies? By John Logan When direct communications known as third party persuading are requested, The Burke Group recommendshttp://www.tbglabor.com/services.aspx?cid=8 its U.S. clients work with ''Labor Information Services,'',{{cite web|title=Labor Information Services|url=http://www.laborinformationservices.com/|accessdate=4 Jan 2010}} where David J Burke is also CEO. This service[http://www.laborinformationservices.com/ LIS website] provides workers a chance to talk "directly" with professional consultants during organizing campaigns which allows questions and answers from sources other than professional union organizers.[http://www.tuc.org.uk/union/index.cfm?mins=267&minors=27&majorsubjectid=14/TUC Organizing Academy in UK]http://www.aflcio.org/aboutus/oi/indspecific.cfm/%20AFLCIO%20Training%20Institute{{Dead link|date=June 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}[http://www.nlc.edu/educational-programs/union-skills-classes/National Labor Institute] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110720013822/http://www.nlc.edu/educational-programs/union-skills-classes/National |date=2011-07-20 }} "Direct communications with employees during union activity must be conducted in strict accordance with the definitions and guidelines provided within the Landrum-Griffin Act known as the [[Labor Management Reporting and Disclosure Act]] passed by the U.S. Congress in 1959. It requires detailed reporting of all monies paid for third party activities be provided via Form LM10 which is later posted for public record."[http://www.tbglabor.com/services.aspx?cid=8#36/TBG website: Services: Direct Communications] According to their webpage, Labor Information Services is necessary because "the increase of non English speaking workers throughout U.S. industries has made communications (third party persuading) to a company's workforce a major challenge. The supervisors and managers at most companies are not bi-lingual, they do not know the law (National Labor Relations Act) nor can they be expected to answer employee questions in the short time frame of a union organizing campaign." Labor Information Services consultants are fluent in [[English language|English]], [[Spanish language|Spanish]], [[Tagalog language|Tagalog]], [[French language|French]], [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]], [[Vietnamese language|Vietnamese]], and a number of [[varieties of Chinese]].http://www.laborinformationservices.com/#3 ==AFL-CIO and TUC Agreement on anti-union activities of U.S. firms== A report released in 2008 called "US Union Avoidance Consultants: A Threat to the Rights of British Workers" commissioned by the [[Trades Union Congress]] (UK) to coincide with their joint announcement with the [[AFL-CIO]] (USA) of their campaign to thwart employer efforts which they claimed to "demonise trade unions and scare employees from joining up."[http://www.tuc.org.uk/union/tuc-14301-f0.cfm/Union Busters not welcome in the UK, see par. 3]{{cite web |url=http://blog.aflcio.org/2008/02/22/afl-cio-uk-unions-join-forces-against-union-busters/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-03-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201000417/http://blog.aflcio.org/2008/02/22/afl-cio-uk-unions-join-forces-against-union-busters/ |archivedate=2008-12-01 |df= }} The campaign was designed to demonise companies which employ consultancies during recognition campaigns and ballot elections.{{cite web |url=http://www.tuc.org.uk/extras/protocolagreement.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-03-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120229224010/http://www.tuc.org.uk/extras/protocolagreement.pdf |archivedate=2012-02-29 |df= }} The report examined tactics allegedly used by U.S. consultants and law firms, including detailed descriptions of Burke Group and clients in the UK.{{cite web |url=http://www.tuc.org.uk/extras/loganreport.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-02-19 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100524160721/http://www.tuc.org.uk/extras/loganreport.pdf |archivedate=2010-05-24 |df= }} In response, a Burke Group press release noted, the "report was biased and misleading based on subjective partisan research for which no request has ever been made to TBG nor its clients to review the veracity of the statements/conclusions contained therein before going to print."{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/markets/2794237/Union-recognition-dispute-ruling-altered-after-consultants-complain.html | work=The Daily Telegraph | location=London | title=Union-recognition dispute ruling altered after consultants complain | first=Richard | last=Tyler | date=2008-08-04 | accessdate=2010-05-25}}.{{cite web|url=http://www.theburkegroup.eu.com/news.aspx?newsID=125|title=CAC Amends Its Judgement About The Burke Group|last=The Burke Group|date=24 July 2008|accessdate=2011-01-02}} ==Cable and Wireless Case Study== In May 2007, the Communication Workers Union in the UK petitioned Cable and Wireless for "automatic recognition" of their Field Service team by filing form 1A which defines and describes the potential unit to the Central Arbitration Committee.http://www.cac.gov.uk/ After review, the Central Arbitration Committee sanctioned the unit. However Cable and Wireless Worldwide decided to challenge the decision due to the relatively small size of the unit and concerns about potential fragmentation.https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/jt200910/jtselect/jtrights/5/5we75.htm/Publications In August 2007, reps employed by the Communication Workers Union were assigned at Cable and Wireless to provide guidance to employees regarding joining their union,.{{cite web |url=http://www.cwu.org/52991/cable-amp-wireless.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-03-18 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130414141229/http://www.cwu.org/52991/cable-amp-wireless.html |archivedate=2013-04-14 |df= }} Cable and Wireless also employed reps to provide guidance to Cable and Wireless management. But according to an article in The Guardian, the Communication Workers Union expressed "shock" saying that such hiring "can only lead to an atmosphere of bitterness and resentment.""CWU attacks Cable & Wireless for hiring US 'union-busters'", The Guardian, http://www.guardian.co.uk/business/2007/aug/18/7 retrieved 6/15/2012. In April 2008, after a review of the “appropriate bargaining unit”, the Central Arbitration Committee ordered a workforce ballot election process (as opposed to automatic recognition) as the best way to decide the most appropriate form of representation. The subsequent ballot election resulted in a 92% turnout of the Cable and Wireless Field Services team where 77% voted against the Communication Worker’s Union as their representative for collective bargaining.[https://books.google.com/books?id=Vxv4mOkheooC&pg=PA328&lpg=PA328&dq=cable+and+wireless+and+CWU+evidence&source=bl&ots=lv8GyAtuCh&sig=l6-JrzCWNrDFDXTPPg4jqKZFlAU&hl=en&sa=X&ei=cxMPUf27MIHViwKkwYCADw&sqi=2&ved=0CD4Q6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=cable%20and%20wireless%20and%20CWU%20evidence&f=false/Any of Our Business?: Human Rights and the UK Private Sector, Volume 2, Joint Committee on Human Rights: Evidence, Ev P 328] In May 2009, to dispute the outcome of the ballot election, the Communication Workers Union filed a complaint to the Central Arbitration Committee and The Joint Committee on Human Rights. Annotated from evidence presented at the hearing:
“The Burke Group (TBG) was engaged by Cable and Wireless to advise them on the statutory recognition process because it was complex and unfamiliar to Cable and Wireless. TBG helped Cable and Wireless to implement a 'fact-based' approach to the ballot process which enabled managers to inform their teams about the union recognition process and what it would mean for them. The Burke Group did not engage directly with employees in the bargaining unit, and they supported the ballot process. Both Cable and Wireless and the Communication Workers Union had equal access to employees and colleagues during the 20 day ballot process.”[https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/jt200910/jtselect/jtrights/5/5we75.htm/Publications Parliament UK],

{{Infobox book | name = The Go-Giver: A Little Story about a Powerful Business Idea | title_orig = | translator = | image = TheGo-Giver.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Hardcover edition | author = Bob Burg
John D. Mann | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = | language = English | series = | subject = Business | genre = [[Self-help]] | publisher = [[Penguin Books|Portfolio]] | pub_date = {{start date|2007|12|27}} | english_pub_date = | media_type = Print | pages = 144 pp. | isbn = 978-1-59184-200-2 | dewey = 650.1 22 | congress = HF5386 .B888 2007 | oclc = 144767865 | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''The Go-Giver: A Little Story about a Powerful Business Idea''''' is a [[business fable|business book]] written by Bob Burg and John D. Mann.{{cite web|url=http://www.burg.com|title=Bob Burg - Influence & Success InsightsHome - Bob Burg - Influence & Success Insights|website=www.burg.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.johndavidmann.com/|title=John David Mann - New York Times Bestselling Author|website=John David Mann}} It is a story about the power of giving. The first edition was published on December 27, 2007 by [[Portfolio Hardcover]]. == Summary == The ''Go-Giver'' as the authors tell, revolves around the story of a young professional (Joe) who is striving for success. Joe is ambitious, however lately it seems like his hard work and efforts are not paying off in terms of results. Following a disappointing quarter—in terms of sales results—he inadvertently seeks the mentorship of ''The Chairman''."http://timesheetchronicles.wordpress.com/2012/01/07/on-the-go-giver/". The Timesheet Chronicles - Omar Halabieh. Joe then embarks on a learning journey by meeting ''Go-Givers''—friends of ''The Chairman''. Through these interactions he learns of the "Five Laws of Stratospheric Success": #Value: ''Your true worth is determined by how much more you give in value than you take in payment.'' #Compensation: ''Your income is determined by how many people you serve and how well you serve them.'' #Influence: ''Your influence is determined by how abundantly you place other people's interests first.'' #Authenticity: ''The most valuable gift you have to offer is yourself.'' #Receptivity: ''The key to effective giving is to stay open to receiving.'' == Reception == ''The Go-Giver's'' fictional story got the attention of prominent business managers, including reviewers at ''[[Business Week]]''.Marshall Goldsmith (March 11, 2008). "[http://www.businessweek.com/managing/content/mar2008/ca20080311_967359.htm What is a Go-Giver?]", ''[[Businessweek]]''. Retrieved on 22 October 2008. The book was #9 on the ''Businessweek'' Best Seller list."[http://www.businessweek.com/pdfs/2008/0810_bestseller.pdf?chan=magazine+channel_opinion The Businessweek best seller list]" (PDF). Retrieved on 22 October 2008. ==See also== * [[Lifestyle guru]] * [[Motivation]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://thegogiver.com ''The Go-Giver'' Official Website] *[http://proguide.io/becoming-a-go-giver-with-bob-burg/ Interview with Bob about "The Go-Giver"] {{DEFAULTSORT:Go-Giver, The}} [[Category:2008 novels]] [[Category:Business books]] [[Category:Business fables]]

{{Refimprove|biography|date=May 2011}} {{nihongo|'''Tōru Shōriki'''|正力 亨|Shōriki Tōru|24 October 1918 – 15 August 2011}} was a Japanese businessman and the owner of The Yomiuri Group, the parent of [[Yomiuri Shimbun]] Holdings. He was the eldest son of its previous owner, [[Matsutarō Shōriki]].
In 1942, he received his degree from the Faculty of Economics at [[Keio University]].
Shōriki was also owner of the [[Yomiuri Giants]]<ref>{{cite news|quote=The agreement for the tour was reached between Toru Shoriki, president of the Yomiuri Giants, Japan's 1965 champion baseball team, and Waller O'Malley, ...|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/baltsun/access/1728201522.html?FMT=CITE&FMTS=CITE:AI&type=historic&date=May+24%2C+1966&author=&pub=The+Sun+(1837-1985)&desc=Dodgers+Slated+To+Tour+Japan&pqatl=google|title=Dodgers Slated To Tour Japan|date=24 May 1966|work=Baltimore Sun|page=C3|accessdate=16 May 2011}}</ref> baseball team from 1964 until 1996, again in succession to his father. He retained the title of "honorary owner" until his death in a hospital in Tokyo on 15 August 2011, aged 92.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/national/news/20110815-OYT1T00350.htm|script-title=ja:読売新聞グループ本社社主、正力亨氏が死去|trans-title=Yomiuri Shimbun Group owner Toru Shoriki dies|date= 15 August 2011|work= Yomiuri Online|publisher= The Yomiuri Shimbun|location= Japan|page= |language= Japanese|archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate= 15 August 2011}}</ref>

Gary Charlwood''' (born 1941) is a [[Germany|German]]-born [[Canadian]] businessman, [[Executive Chairman]] and CEO of Charlwood Pacific Group, Founder & Executive Chairman of [[Century 21 (real estate)|CENTURY 21 Canada]], and Chairman CEO & Founder of Uniglobe Travel International. In 2017, Charlwood was ranked as the 92nd richest person in Canada.{{cite news|title=Canada’s Richest People: U. Gary Charlwood|url=http://www.canadianbusiness.com/lists-and-rankings/richest-people/rich-100-u-gary-charlwood/|publisher=[[Canadian Business]]|date=December 24, 2015}} In 2015, Charlwood was named''The Most Powerful Person in Residential Real Estate'' by the [[Stefan Swanepoel|Swanepoel Power 200]].{{cite book|author1=Stefan Swanepoel|authorlink1=Stefan Swanepoel|title=Swanepoel Power 200 The Most Powerful Person in Residential Real Estate 2014-15|date=2014|publisher=RealSure, Inc.|isbn=978-0-9863779-1-4|page=35|url=http://www.retrends.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/SPT2015-Swanepoel-Power-200-Book-Reduced.pdf}} == Early life & education == Born in [[Germany]], he moved to [[London]] in 1948 to join his mother, who had remarried after his father’s death. Later he attended [[University of Southampton]]. == Career== Charlwood serves as the [[executive chairman]] of Charlwood Pacific Group, which owns Century 21 Asia-Pacific, Uniglobe Travel International, Centum Financial Group and Real Property Management Canada. These companies have more than 1,700 franchise locations with more than 26,000 support staff in 561 cities in 67 countries, making it one of the largest international franchise systems in [[Canada]], reportedly by [[REM (magazine)]].{{cite news|last1=McCloskey|first1=Dennis|title=U. Gary Charlwood reflects on 40 years of Century 21 in Canada|url=http://www.remonline.com/u-gary-charlwood-reflects-40-years-century-21-canada/|publisher=[[REM (magazine)|REM]]|date=October 28, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Vanderklippe|first1=Nathan|title=Century 21 franchisor still going '120mph'|url=http://www.ugarycharlwood.com/UGC_NATIONAL_POST.pdf|publisher=[[National Post]]|archiveurl=http://www.thejournaloffranchise.com/Franchise-News/Franchise-news.php?id=125|archivedate=February 13, 2008}} He established UNIGLOBE Travel International in 1979, which is one of the largest travel agencies in number of outlets in the world.{{cite book|author1=Berendien Lubbe|title=Tourism Distribution: Managing the Travel Intermediary|date=2000|publisher=Juta and Company Ltd|isbn=978-07-02154-1-88|pages=108, 109, 110|url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=AVtWc5BoLAQC&dq=Entrepreneur+of+the+Year+U.+Gary+Charlwood&source=gbs_navlinks_s}} In 1975 U. Gary along with [[Peter H. Thomas]] bought the franchise rights for [[Century 21 (real estate)|Century 21]] Real Estate Canada.{{cite news|title=Century 21 Canada offices raise record breaking $682,000 for local Easter Seals|url=http://www.remonline.com/century-21-canada-offices-raise-record-breaking-682000-for-local-easter-seals/|publisher=[[REM (magazine)|REM]]|date=March 22, 2016}} But unfortunately, the [[Century 21 (real estate)|Century 21]] concept was shut down by the Real Estate Council of BC, as it was claimed that franchising was illegal in the real estate brokerage business.{{cite news|title=Successful Canadian franchise entrepreneurs share expansion lessons|url=http://www.scmp.com/business/companies/article/1966879/successful-canadian-franchise-entrepreneurs-share-expansion|publisher=[[South China Morning Post]]|date=June 16, 2016}} Charlwood challenged the ruling in court and won, following which he successfully opened the door to a wide array of American brokerages now commonplace in [[Canada]], including [[RE/MAX]], [[Coldwell Banker]] and, more recently, [[Royal LePage]].{{cite journal|title=Once In A Century|journal=REP|date=April 2015|issue=1.01|page=18|url=https://issuu.com/keymedia/docs/repc_1.01_emag}} CENTURY 21 Canada was the first real estate brokerage company with offices coast to coast in [[Canada]]. Currently, [[Century 21 (real estate)|Century 21]] remains one of the largest companies in Canada with more than 400 locations and 10,000 system members. The Charlwood Pacific Group also holds 50% ownership in Century 21 Asia Pacific. His Canadian and Asian Century 21 companies have a combined 939 franchisees, employing 19000 salespeople as of June 2016. In 2002, he founded Centum, a [[mortgage brokerage]] franchise brand. His Canadian and Asian Century 21 companies have a combined 939 franchisees, employing 19,000 salespeople, as of June 2016.,{{cite news|last1=Korstrom|first1=Glen|title=Successful franchise entrepreneurs share expansion lessons|url=https://biv.com/article/2016/06/successful-franchise-entrepreneurs-share-expansion|publisher=[[Business in Vancouver]]|date=June 5, 2016}} In 2010, he acquired the Real Property Management (RPM) rights for Canada, a [[Utah]] based company which manages properties for real estate investors.{{cite news|title=Charlwood Pacific Group brings property management franchise to Canada|url=http://www.remonline.com/charlwood-pacific-group-brings-property-management-franchise-to-canada/|publisher=[[REM (magazine)|REM]]|date=January 31, 2011}} Before starting his own company, Charlwood also worked for [[Western Airlines]] (now [[Delta Air Lines]]) and [[CP Air]] (now [[Air Canada]]). He was elected as Chairman of the International Franchise Association of Washington, DC, the only non-American to ever hold the position.{{cite news|title=Appointments|url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P2-659359.html|publisher=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|date=April 6, 1998}} == Awards and recognition == * Charlwood Pacific Group received the Canadian Franchise Association Hall of Fame Award in 2016.{{cite news|last1=Rosal|first1=Christine|title=Awards Spotlight: 2016 Hall of Fame Award Winner U. Gary Charlwood|url=https://www.cfa.ca/awards-spotlight-2016-hall-of-fame-award-winner-u-gary-charlwood/|accessdate=April 4, 2018|publisher=CFA.ca}}{{cite news|title=Century 21 Canada founder accepts Canadian Franchise Association Hall of Fame Award|url=http://www.remonline.com/century-21-canada-founder-accepts-canadian-franchise-association-hall-of-fame-award/|publisher=[[REM (magazine)|REM]]|date=May 18, 2016}} * He was included in the Swanepoel Power 200 list for 2014-15 as #80th Most Powerful Person in Residential Real Estate. * He was inducted to the [[Hall of Fame]] by the [[American Society of Travel Agents]] (ASTA) in 2009.{{cite news|title=U. Gary Charlwood awarded travel industry’s top honor|url=https://www.eturbonews.com/22725/u-gary-charlwood-awarded-travel-industrys-top-honor|publisher=Eturbonews|date=September 14, 2009}}{{cite web|title=Travel Hall of Fame|url=https://www.asta.org/About/content.cfm?ItemNumber=970|website=[[American Society of Travel Agents|Asta.org]]|accessdate=April 4, 2018}}{{cite news|title=The Charlwood Pacific Group Receives 2016 Canadian Franchise Association Hall of Fame Award|url=https://ca.finance.yahoo.com/news/charlwood-pacific-group-receives-2016-133000506.html|publisher=[[Yahoo! News]]|date=April 19, 2016}} * He was inductee to the International Franchise Association Hall of Fame in 2007.{{cite news|title=2007 Hall of Fame|url=https://www.franchise.org/2007-hall-of-fame-award|accessdate=April 4, 2018|publisher=Franchise.org}}{{cite news|title=First-ever Canadian in franchise hall of fame|url=https://www.pressreader.com/canada/national-post-latest-edition/20080211/282144992035525|publisher=[[National Post]]|date=February 11, 2008}}{{cite journal|last1=Korstrom|first1=Glen|title=Vancouver franchise builder wins industry's biggest honour|journal=[[Business in Vancouver]]|date=March 4–10, 2008|issue=958}} * Received 1991 Entrepreneur of the Year by International Franchise Association {{cite web|title=Entrepreneur of the Year|url=https://www.franchise.org/entrepreneur-of-the-year|website=Franchise.org|publisher=IFA|date=February 2007}} == See also == {{portal |Biography|Business|Canada}} * [[List of Canadians by net worth]] * [[List of Canadians]] ==References== {{Reflist}} == Further reading == * {{cite book|editor1-last=Davis|editor1-first=Chuck|title=The greater Vancouver book: an urban encyclopaedia|date=January 1, 1997|publisher=Linkman Press|isbn=1896846009|page=496}} == External links == * [http://www.ugarycharlwood.com/ Official website] * [https://www.ocregister.com/2008/03/01/franchising-provides-opportunity-to-build/ Franchising provides opportunity to build] at ''[[OCregister]]'' * [http://www.ugarycharlwood.com/REM_UGC.pdf In conversation with Gary Charlwood] at [[REM (magazine)]] (Issue #231; Pg.16) * [https://biv.com/article/2013/01/how-i-did-it-gary-charlwood How I did it: U. A '''Unique Transaction Identifier''' ([[Acronym]]: '''UTI'''), alternatively called '''Unique Swap Identifier''' (Acronym: '''USI''') is a globally [[unique identifier]] for individual [[Financial transaction|transactions]] in financial markets. USIs were introduced in late 2012 in the U.S. in the context of [[Dodd-Frank]] regulation, where reporting of transactions to [[Trade Repository|Trade Repositories]] first became mandatory. European financial market regulations followed suit, with reporting to Trade Repositories under [[European Market Infrastructure Regulation|EMIR]] requiring UTIs from February 2014 on. The use of the UTI is also mandatory for regulatory reporting under [[Regulation on Wholesale Energy Market Integrity and Transparency|REMIT]]. Strictly speaking, the term USI is specific to the U.S. regulation, while UTI is specific to EU regulations. In practice, both terms are used interchangeable, in particular within large trading firms reporting under both regimes.
== Structure == A UTI/USI is an [[alphanumeric]] code of fixed length, with the maximum length defined as either 42 (U.S.) or 52 (EU) characters. The UTI typically consists of a [[Substring#Prefix|prefix]] followed by the [[Concatenation|concatenated]] code value. Taken together, prefix and value form the UTI, and should be globally unique.
The prefix portion of the UTI code should be a unique code for the code issueing authority. Ideally, the prefix would have reused the [[Legal Entity Identifier]] (LEI) of the entity issueing the UTI. LEI codes are used across the financial reporting regimes in the U.S. (Dodd-Frank) and Europe (EMIR / MiFID). However, the LEI code length of 20 characters represented a problem for many systems, which in practice limited the usable prefix length to 10 characters. In June 2013, [[International Swaps and Derivatives Association|ISDA]] working groups suggested that the characters 7 through 16 of the 20 character global LEI number should be used as the UTI prefix. This would have led to clashes between UTIs generated for different organisations having the same characters 7 through 16 in their LEIs. Now the recommended best practice entails a 10 character UTI Prefix, algorithmically derived from an entity’s 20 character LEI using [[Hash function|hash algorithms]].
The second component of the UTI is the code value, sometimes called the Transaction Identifier part. The CFTC defines the transaction identifier part as an alphanumeric code of variable length, up to a maximum of 32 characters. In addition to alphanumeric characters, certain special characters are permissible as internal delimiters: [[Colon (punctuation)|colon]], [[hyphen]], [[Full stop|period]], and [[underscore]]. These special characters may not start or end the code, nor may they be used consecutively.
The [[European Securities and Markets Authority|ESMA]] recommend that the Trade ID should be formed by the concatenation (without separators) of the three elements; the characters 'E02', the [[Legal Entity Identifier|LEI]] of the generating entity and a unique Trade ID generated by the generating entity. The prefixes 'E00' through 'E99' are reserved by the [[European Securities and Markets Authority|ESMA]].
[[Check digit]]s are not a prescribed part of the UTI, but some issueing systems have them as part of the code value.
== Sources == * [[European Securities and Markets Authority|ESMA]](editors): "[https://www.esma.europa.eu/sites/default/files/library/2016-293_qa_xvi_on_emir_implementation.pdf Questions and Answers Implementation of the Regulation (EU) No 648/2012 on OTC derivatives, central counterparties and trade repositories (EMIR]". February 16, 2016. * [[Commodity Futures Trading Commission|CFTC]] (editors): ''[http://www.cftc.gov/idc/groups/public/@swaps/documents/dfsubmission/usidatastandards100112.pdf Unique Swap Identifier (USI) - Data Standard]''. October 1, 2012. * [[International Swaps and Derivatives Association|ISDA]] (editors): ''[http://www.fpml.org/documents/USI%20Overview%20Document%20final%20version.pdf Unique Swap Identifier (USI) : An Overview Document]''. June 7, 2012. * ISDA (editors): ''[http://www2.isda.org/attachment/NzMzMQ==/2015%20Mar%2020%20UTI%20Best%20Practice%20v11.0_clean.pdf Unique Trade Identifier (UTI): Generation, Communication and Matching]''. March 20, 2015. * [[Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators|ACER]] (editors): ''[https://www.acer-remit.eu/portal/document-download?documentId=2613 Trade Reporting User Manual (TRUM), Annex IV - Guidance on UTI v1.0]'', March 8, 2016.
== External links == * [http://uti.efetnet.org/ UTI generation for commodity trading] at the [[European Federation of Energy Traders]] (EFET)

{{Infobox person |name = William Byrd III |image = Portrait, William Byrd III, John Hesselius.jpg |caption = Portrait by [[John Hesselius]] |birth_name = William Byrd III |birth_date = {{Birth date|1728|09|06}} |birth_place = [[Charles City, Virginia]] |death_date = January 1 or January 2, 1777 |death_place = Charles City, Virginia |body_discovered = |death_cause = [[Suicide]] |resting_place = Old Westover Church cemetery |residence = [[Westover Plantation]] |nationality = [[United States|American]] |education = [[Westminster School]], [[Middle Temple]] |occupation = Planter, Soldier, Member of the Virginia House of Burgesses, Gambler |spouse = Eliza Carter
[[Mary Willing]] |children = 10, including [[Charles Willing Byrd]] |parents = [[William Byrd II]]
Maria Taylor |relations = |signature = }} '''William Byrd III''' (September 6, 1728{{spaced ndash}}January 1 or January 2, 1777) was the son of [[William Byrd II]] and the grandson of [[William Byrd I]].{{cite web|last1=Evans|first1=Emory G.|title=William Byrd (1728–1777)|url=http://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/Byrd_William_1728-1777|publisher=Encyclopedia Virginia|accessdate=15 July 2015}} He inherited his family's estate of approximately 179,000 acres of land in Virginia and continued their planter prestige as a member of the [[Virginia House of Burgesses]]. He chose to fight in the [[French and Indian War]] rather than spend much time in Richmond. In 1756 he was colonel of the Second [[Virginia Regiment]]. William Byrd III had a reputation as a notorious gambler. He initiated what was said to have been the first major horse race in the New World, involving other planters [[Samuel Ogle]], [[John Tayloe II]], Francis Thornton, and [[Benjamin Tasker Jr.]] Byrd III eventually fathered five children by his first wife (Eliza Carter, m. 1748, d. 1760), and fathered ten more by his second wife, [[Mary Willing]], daughter of [[Charles Willing]] of [[Philadelphia]]. After he squandered the Byrd fortune on building a magnificent mansion at [[Westover Plantation]], gambling, and bad investments, Byrd III parceled up much of the land he had inherited from his father and sold it off to raise money to pay his debts. He also sold the enslaved African laborers who had worked on his estate. Although his sale of land and slaves generated a huge sum it still was not enough to pay off his creditors. Later, Byrd resorted to a lottery, the prizes of which would come from his estate, Belvidere, at the falls of the [[James River]]. However the lottery failed to generate sufficient revenue.{{cite book|last=Dabney|first=Virginius|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Auw-cdKZmnoC&pg=PA19#v=onepage&q&f=false|title=Richmond: The Story of a City: Revised and Expanded Edition|page=19|year=1990|location=[[Charlottesville, Virginia]]|publisher=University Press of Virginia|isbn=0813912741|oclc=20263021}} At [[Google Books]]. Despondent and nearly broke, Byrd III committed [[suicide]] on January 1 or 2, 1777. He was buried in the cemetery at the old [[Westover Church]]. The 10 children of his second marriage (to [[Mary Willing]]) were: Maria Horsmanden Byrd, Evelyn Taylor Byrd, Charles Willing Byrd (died as child), Abby Byrd, Anne Willing Byrd, William Boyd Byrd, [[Charles Willing Byrd]], Dorothy Byrd (died as child), Jane Byrd and Richard Willing Byrd. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.history.org/almanack/people/bios/biowbyrd.cfm William Byrd III] at History.org *{{findagrave|40885971}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Byrd, William 03}} [[Category:1728 births]] [[Category:1777 deaths]] [[Category:American racehorse owners and breeders]] [[Category:People of Virginia in the French and Indian War]] [[Category:British America army officers]] [[Category:House of Burgesses members]] [[Category:People of colonial Maryland]] [[Category:American politicians who committed suicide]] [[Category:Byrd family of Virginia|William Byrd 03]] [[Category:American people of English descent]] [[Category:American planters]] [[Category:American slave owners]]

{{for|the Nevada Supreme Court justice|William H. Beatty}} '''William Henry Beatty''' (December 10, 1833 – November 20, 1912), was a [[Canada|Canadian]] lawyer and businessman.
William Henry Beatty was the eldest of three sons and five daughters of James Beatty, an Irish born Toronto merchant. James had operated the British Woollen and Cotton Warehouse on the south side of [[King Street (Toronto)|King Street]] and had served in the militia, rising to the rank of Colonel. In 1832, he had married Ann, the daughter of James McKowen of Dublin. He was educated at [[Upper Canada College]] from 1842 to 1845. Some years later Beatty decided to study law. He articled with [[John Leys (politician)|John Leys]] and attended lectures at [[Osgoode Hall]]. He was admitted to the Bar February 5, 1863 and entered into partnership with Edward Marion Chadwick who was from an important Guelph family also of Irish origin and his future brother-in-law. On Tuesday 28 June 1864, Chadwick married Beatty's sister, Ellen at St. James Cathedral. Regrettably Ellen, the woman who had brought the two partners together, died suddenly in February of the following year, after only a few hours of illness. Chadwick's short-lived marriage to Ellen may have helped cement the partnership, but the success of the firm was intimately connected with Beatty's marriage. In April, 1865, Beatty remarried Charlotte Louisa Worts at [[Little Trinity Anglican Church]]. She was the eldest daughter of [[James Gooderham Worts]], was one of the two partners in the [[Gooderham & Worts]] distillery and milling business and an important figure in a number of other businesses.
Beatty and Chadwick remained partners for almost 50 years. Of the two, it was Beatty who made the firm Canada's largest law firm, numbering 16 lawyers in 1901. As a lawyer, Beatty helped his clients establish and manage their businesses. He remained the managing partner of the firm until 1906, personally overseeing the many details of its operation.
Beatty was also a businessman. By 1890 he had become the principal legal and business adviser to the Gooderham and Worts business empire and was one of the most prominent members of the developing Canadian financial community. At various times, he served as a director of Gooderham & Worts, Limited. (the company he incorporated on Worts' death to continue the partnership business), Vice-President of London and Ontario Investment Company and Canada's first trust company, the Toronto General Trusts Corporation, and was President of the [[Bank of Toronto]], the Toronto Silver Plate Company, the Canada Permanent Mortgage Corporation and the Confederation Life Association, an insurance company that he helped found in 1871 and manage for over forty years .
He was active in the [[Toronto Board of Trade]], co-authoring with [[Wallace Nesbitt]] a set of arbitration rules for the board. He also represented the Board in 1896 at the Congress of the Chambers of Commerce of the British Empire in London, England.
Although, in his words he did not take "any active interest in politics", he was a "true blue Conservative" and when he thought it necessary, he used his political connections and his personal friendship with [[John A. Macdonald|Sir John A. Macdonald]] and [[Charles Tupper|Sir Charles Tupper]] to assist his clients.

Ian Kyer, Lawyers, Families, and Businesses: The Shaping of a Bay Street Law Firm, Faskens 1863-1963'']

{{refimprove|date=March 2015}} The '''World Chamber of Commerce (WCC)''' is a 501(c)(3) [[non-profit]] global organization dedicated to fostering international trade, cultural and humanitarian cooperation. The World Chamber organizes initiatives and events targeted at furthering these aims. The WCC develops partnerships and acts as a liaison between international and local businesses, supporting efforts from embassies, consulates, multilateral organizations, bi-national chambers of commerce, and businesses promoting global commerce, economic, cultural and social exchange. The WCC headquarters is in Atlanta, United States.
==History== The World Chamber of Commerce was founded by International Trade Consultant Solange Warner in 2008. The organization's first activities were a set of successful international trade seminars which served to bring together the international and local business community in Atlanta. Warner also developed the " WCC International Hero Award" to recognize individuals who have demonstrated excellence in international trade, cultural and humanitarian work; along with the "WCC International Trade Process" to assist international business with initial complimentary advice, when entering the U.S. business market.
==Programs and events highlights== *"International Trade Seminars"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globalatlanta.com/article/16952/world-chamber-of-commerce-to-host-international-trade-seminar-in-atlanta-on-wednesday-nov-19/ |title=World Chamber of Commerce to Host International Trade Seminar in Atlanta on Wednesday, Nov. 19 |publisher=Globalatlanta.com |date=2008-11-11 |accessdate=2015-03-28}}</ref> *"Meet the World in Atlanta"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/atlanta/blog/interbiz/2009/12/world_chamber_honors_young_turner.html |title=World Chamber honors Young, Turner - Atlanta Business Chronicle |publisher=Bizjournals.com |date= |accessdate=2015-03-28}}</ref> *"World Business Forum"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globalatlanta.com/gallery/14/world-chamber-holds-awards-event-at-state-capitol/ |title=World Chamber Holds Awards Event at State Capitol - Photo Gallery from |publisher=GlobalAtlanta.com |date=2014-09-05 |accessdate=2015-03-28}}</ref> *"Global Business and Environmental Summit"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globalatlanta.com/event/4354/world-chamber-of-commerce-global-business-and-environmental-summit/ |title=World Chamber of Commerce Global Business and Environmental Summit |publisher=GlobalAtlanta.com |date=2013-11-14 |accessdate=2015-03-28}}</ref> *"Global Economic and Film Production Forum"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globalatlanta.com/event/4605/world-chamber-of-commerce-global-economic-and-film-production-forum/ |title=World Chamber of Commerce Global Economic and Film Production Forum |publisher=GlobalAtlanta.com |date=2014-02-06 |accessdate=2015-03-28}}</ref>
==Officers== The World Chamber of Commerce's honorary chairs include former Atlanta mayor and U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations [[Andrew Young]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/atlanta/print-edition/2012/06/15/andrew-young.html |title=Andrew Young - Atlanta Business Chronicle |publisher=Bizjournals.com |date=2012-06-15 |accessdate=2015-03-28}}</ref> the former president of Colombia, [[Alvaro Uribe]], the Premier of Bermuda, [[Paula Cox]], presidential candidate and former Governor of New Mexico [[Gary Johnson]], LucasFilm VP [[Howard Kazanjian]] and actor and environmentalist [[Ed Begley, Jr.]]. The Executive Committee consists of three chairmen of the board- Charles Shapiro, former U.S. Ambassador to Venezuela, Denis Barbet,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/atlanta/news/2014/04/22/barbet-tapped-as-co-chairman-of-world-chamber-of.html |title=Barbet tapped as co-chairman of World Chamber of Commerce - Atlanta Business Chronicle |publisher=Bizjournals.com |date=2014-04-22 |accessdate=2015-03-28}}</ref> Consul General of France in the Southeast U.S. and Solange Warner, founder of the World Chamber of Commerce. The President of the WCC board is Roma Klicius, honorary consul of Lithuania, the vice president is Dan Moss, Jr., Senior VP at Morgan Stanley, the Secretaries are Charles Kuck and Richard Summers, attorneys at law, and the Treasurer is Wayne Johnson, Principal at Johnson Consulting Services.
==Humanitarian initiatives== The World Chamber of Commerce has created the initiative: "Human Trafficking Awareness to Keep Our Children Safe" to end human trafficking in concert with several humanitarian organizations. Additionally, the World Chamber of Commerce has created initiatives to provide aid to victims of earthquakes in Haiti and Chile.
